links.title: The United States Air Force Continues to Aim High With BlackBerry AtHoc
links.description: Whether operating during times of crisis or keeping people safe supporting the day-to-day mission, effective communication is everything. The United States Air Force (USAF) understands this. That's why for more than ten years, the USAF has trusted AtHoc, Blackberry's leading crisis communications solution, to keep personnel connected, protected, and secure.

Apple looks to return to head of class in education market $AAPL #AAPL https://www.marketbeat.com/n/3870886/

links.title: Apple looks to return to head of class in education market
links.description: Posted on Tuesday, March 27th, 2018 By The Associated Press CHICAGO (AP) - Apple is hoping to return to the head of the class in the competition to get high-tech products into U.S. classrooms. The trend-setting company is expected to provide more details about its renewed emphasis on education Tuesday at a Chicago high school.

links.title: PACIFIC for March 26: Apple fires on Facebook
links.description: Apple executives are highlighting Facebook's weaknesses in an effort to distinguish themselves as a responsible tech company that values data privacy, editorial responsibility and accountability. links.title: Main Street $M
links.description: Based on daily AAPL closing prices from 12/26/91 to 02/13/18 the issue rose more than four percent 415 times. The issue continued to rally on the following day 175 times. The largest following rally occurred on 10/13/08 when the issue closed higher by 14 percent.

messages.body: Big rebound for stocks, is it going to continue? $AMZN $NFLX $AAPL $GOOGL #FANG https://investmentsrevolution.com/2018/03/technology-stocks-boosts-wall-street-as-trade-war-fears-ease/

links.title: Technology stocks boosts Wall Street as trade war fears ease - Investments Revolution
links.description: Technology stocks led Wall Street's rebound on Monday as fears over a potential trade war eased following reports the U.S. and China are willing to renegotiate tariffs and trade imbalances. All three major U.S. indexes were up more than 2 percent after their worst weekly performance since January 2016.
